newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: South American port conditions - Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: South American port conditions - Lloyds.

text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --

ARGENTINA, Aug 20 - Santa Fe - no vessels berthed/in roads/ due. Max recommended draft 19 ft 5 IN at access channel. Diamante - no vessels berthed/in roads, 1 due. Max Draft 17 ft. 4 at passage km 520. San Lorenzo - four vessels berthed of which 1 loading sbmp, 1 loading sbm, 1 loading sorghum/soy, 1 loading cotton oils, 6 in roads 26 due at 9 terminals during coming week Max recommended draft guided by Emilio Mitre channel. Rosario - 10 vessels berthed of which 1 awaiting orders, 4 discharging fertiliser, 1 loading sugar, 1 loading fruit, 1 loading sbo, 1 loading wheat, 1 loading soy 4 in roads 17 due in next week. Recommended draft guided by EM channel. Villa Constitucion -no vessels berthed/in roads, 2 due. Max recommended draft 9 ft 6 Acindar/Puerto Acevedo (iron ore/steel products): guided by EM channel. San Nicolas five vessels berthed 1 discharging steel products, 1 iron ore, 1 coils, 1 coal, 1 zinc. No vessels in roads 8 due in coming week. Max recommended draft guided by EM channel. San Pedro - no vessels berthed/in roads 1 due. Recommended draft guided by EM channel. Max recommended draft for EM channel as follows (high tide) 28 ft 9 in FW. Buenos Aires - 23 vessels in Port 30due during coming week. Max Recommended draft 31 ft FW (guided by entrance channel/high tide). Necochea - three vessels berthed of which 2 discharging dap, 1 loading maize, 4 in roads 11 due during coming week. Max. draft 40 ft. Bahia Blanca - eight vessels berthed of which 2 awaiting orders, 1 discharging dap, 1 discharging fertiliser, 1 loading wheat, 1 loading naphtha, 1 loading malt, 1 loading sunflower/soy pellets, 2 in roads, 16 due during coming week.

BRAZIL, Aug 20 - Vitoria - vessels berthed 4 general cargo/containers discharging/loading, 1 granite loader, 1 pig iron loader, 1 steel coil loader, 1 sar loader. Tubarao 3 iron ore loaders. Praia Mole 2 steel plates loaders. Portocel no vessels. Ubu 1 iron ore loader 15 Vessels waiting in roads. Santos - vessels berthed 6 full containers, 1 cement discharger, 9 sugar loaders, 3 general cargo, 2 lpg dischargers, 1 bulk pellets loader, 2 citrus juice loaders, 4 wheat dischargers, 5 fertiliser dischargers. 26 vessels waiting in roads, 90 due in next 7 days. Private terminals - Cosipa 1 bulk coal discharger, 2 steel products loaders, 1 iron ore discharger. Ultrafertil 1 sulphur discharger. Itajai - vessels berthed 2 full containers, 2 reefers, 3 waiting in roads, 9 due during next 7 days. Rio Grande - vessels berthed 2 bulk fertiliser dischargers, 4 full containers, 2 soy loaders, 1 discharger. 3 waiting in roads, 31 due during next 10 days. Sao Sebastiao - vessels berthed Tebar 2 vessels. Three vessels waiting in roads. Five due during next 7 days. Parana - vessels berthed 3 pellets loaders, 1 frozen goods loader, 1 fertiliser discharger, 2 sugar loaders, 1 barley discharger/loader, 1 acid discharger, 1 garlic discharger, 1 container discharger/loader, 1 rice discharger. 66 waiting in roads of which 14 agribulk products for loading, 18 sugar for loading, 2 frozen goods for loading 15 pellets for loading. 13 fertiliser, 2 general cargo, 2 wheat for discharging.

CHILE, Aug 19 - Arica - Three vessels operating, 3 berths vacant, no vessels waiting in roads. No swell. 10 vessels due in week. Iquique - three vessels operating, 3 berths vacant, no vessels waiting in roads, 15 due in week. Antofagasta - four vessels berthed, 3 berths available, 11 vessels due during week for loading and discharging concentrates, copper bars, containers and general cargo. 1 in roads awaiting cargo. Valparaiso - five vessels berthed, working normally, 4 berths vacant, 1 out of service. 2 vessels in roads awaiting cargo, 14 due during week. San antonio - five vessels operating, 4 berths vacant, 17 vessels due during week, 1 in roads awaiting cargo. Conception Bay ports - Talcahuano - one vessel berthed, no berths available, 2 vessels due this week, none in roads. San vicente - three vessels berthed, Working normally, no berths available, 1 in roads, 3 due during week. Steel pier 1 vessel in port, 1 berth available, 1 vessel due this week, none in roads. Oil terminal 2 operating, no berths vacant. No vessels due this week. Lirquen - five operating, 1 berth vacant, no vessels in roads, 2 due during week. Puerto Montt two berths available, no vessels in roads/due. Punta Arenas - five berthed, no berths vacant, 4 vessels and coaster due during week, none in roads.

VENEZUELA, Aug 19 - Puerto Cabello - one vessel anchored, 10 berthed of which 5 grain, 2 general cargo, 1 bulk cargo, 1 ro/ro, 1 under repairs. Piers 1 and 2 closed. Guanta - two vessels anchored, 4 general cargo vessels berthed. Aug 20 - Orinoco river - draft 37 ft 6 in. Puerto Ordaz - one vessel loading briquettes, 5 due. Palua - one vessel loading iron ore, 1 under repairs, 1 due. Mile 178 - one vessel waiting at anchorage to load. Boca Grande - one vessel loading iron ore, 1 due. Venalum - two vessels operating, 1 loading aluminium, 1 discharging coke. 2 due. Matanzas - 11 operating of which 3 loading steel, 2 discharging scrap, 2 loading steel billets, 1 loading briquettes, 1 discharging pitch, 1 discharging coke, 1 inter coastal. 2 due. Alcasa - one vessel discharging coke. Punta Cuchillo - two vessels due. Guanta - three operating of which 2 discharging grain, 1 loading generals, 5 due. Puerto Cabello - 15 vessels operating of which 8 loading/discharging generals, 5 discharging grain, 2 discharging sugar, 17 due? 1 waiting at anchorage to load, 1 under repairs/drydock. La Guaira - three vessels loading/discharging generals, 5 due.
